ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How often does your (husband/wife/companion) make you feel loved and cared for?
How often do you feel your (husband/wife/companion) makes too many demands on you?
How often is your (husband/wife/companion) willing to listen when you need to talk about your worries or problems?
How often is he/she critical of what you do?
How often can you count on your spouse to help with daily tasks like shopping, giving you a ride or helping you with household tasks?
How often does your spouse give you advice or information about medical, financial or family problems?
